rComments: He is terrible prof who is hard to understand and lectures seem to have no structure. He will go off on useless tangents for lengths of time. His tests are ridiculously difficult and don't help achieve an understanding of the material. Overall, he absolutely butchered a topic that I am extremely passionate a bout and that is the biggest offense.
very impressive prof and focused plenty of details, overall he is a awesome prof.

ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE CLASS AND PROF! His tests are so unfair because they don't test your knowledge; they test your ability to predict the future (ie guess which irrelevant information he's going to choose to put on from the 30 pages of handouts). If you decide to take the test, good luck memorizing 50 dates and being only asked FIVE. Get out now.

Great class, great prof. If you show up and listen to what he says (and if you pay attention to the points he spends time on) you can easily get an A. Textbooks were interesting but not essential. If you skip class you will fail. Some memorizing of dates/places but paying attention to him far more important.

I've only taken a few Humanities courses during my undergrad, but by far Cottier is the worse of them all. I haven't learned anything about Roman history besides of sack of Rome in 390 BCE. Tests consists of memorizing places and worse an excessive number of dates without ever considering their historical significance.

Cottier is helpful, funny, and highly knowledgeable. He has an accent but that doesn't mean you can't understand him. BUT his tests ask for specific and irrelevant facts and not for significance i.e. who when and what but not why (cause/effect). Don't expect to learn through critical thinking or analysis its all memorization. Nice man, bad teacher.

I found Cottier spoke really fast and didn't repeat important information.  I really didn't like how he chose extremely specific questions on tests and exams, but his lecture notes/handouts were very detailed and informative.  However, I would not take a class with him again.
Clearly the people who are angry at this teacher are either girls who have been turned down, or guys who are jealous!

Cottier is a passionate and extremely helpful prof. He is genuinely there for the students. Some of the negative comments here are clearly those of ignorant people. Just because he has an accent and may not pronounce places as we're used to does not tell anything about his intelligence. If you study you will do well. He does not trick you.

Seminar class grew tedious from weak student presentations; Cottier himself, however, was brilliant, extremely helpful, and clearly possessed a deep knowledge of his chosen field.  His Swiss accent is also soothing to listen to. Tests posed questions that were simple, but not tediously so: all levels of ability should feel welcome and comfortable.

Professor Cottier is an great professor. He took a real step teaching this 300 level class, and you can tell he cares about the subject through his interest and dedication. He is helpful and not at all hard to approach. And his accent is VERY hot. I don't know where these people are coming from saying it's incomprehensible. It's quite simple.

I can't belive what people have been saying about because he is an incredible Prof! Cottier cares exceedingly about his students, and wants you to do well. I am taking my third class with him this semester. Any of his 3rd of 4th year seminars follow the same easy format and if you do the work you'll do well. A great Prof & a kind and caring person.

I really enjoyed this course. I loved going to the lectures & doing all the readings both of which were interesting. Tests were relatively easy. His really cares about his students & tries to accomodate them concerns and questions. He is very knowledgeable & occasionally humourous. However, the exam was marked brutally which impacts the final mark.

this guy is the WORST PROF i have EVER EVER HAD! he is horrible. He cant teach, he cant speak english, he doesnt even know how to pronounce places on the map! his test were another story-completely irrelevant info was tested! absolutely the worst experience ive ever had in a classics class. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE if he is teaching!!

I enjoy his lectures, he has online outlines of everything he says, makes studying that much easier. The tests aren't hard if you actaully think about it. All in all, very enjoyable class with a caring prof.

this man is the worst prof ever. dont take any of his classes. he is such a poor excuse for a prof. how he ended up at uft, god alone knows. he shouldnt be allowed to teach at all! the class could have been SO good. but his tests were ridiculous and utter garbage. plus, he is a weak lecturer. can't explain anything with clarity.don't take his class

the worst professor ever. such a poor lecturer.his tests made absolutely no sense!I am a classics major student. he totally destroyed my "A" streak.you can read everything and still do badly on his exams,mainly because he tests on the most irrelevant information.AND HIS ACCENT IS GROSS-he barely speaks english.dont take class if he is teaching!!!

he's very enthusastic and willing to help, but i found his lectures just had TOO much material, he didnt emphasize the important details enough.  the test inturn were not that fair, i wasnt sure what would be on them.  he's very intrested in the topic and tried to clarify but i didnt like his lecture style. a plus, he's got that sexy accent.
Very enthusiastic and nice, and welcomed questions, eager to answer them. Although the class was quite hard and there was a lot to memorize.
No Comments

A hard marker on a hard course, but an excellent, good natured and entertaining instructor. His tests come back with the most detailed comments I've ever seen. They are extremely helpful and make his expectations absolutely clear. The course was a real growth experience.
